name: dublin
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the capital city of the Republic of Ireland, situated in the northeast of the country, on the coast: A huge crowd greeted the team back in Dublin. New York, Dublin, Paris, Frankfurt and Amsterdam were favourite destinations.
More examplesFewer examplesThe airline runs a direct scheduled flight from Dublin to Lisbon.He owns a house and 250 acres of land in the most expensive area of north Dublin.The last time I was in Dublin, the traffic was all snarled up.

(also County Dublin, uk/ˌkaʊn.ti ˈdʌb.lɪn/ us/ˌkaʊn.t̬i ˈdʌb.lɪn/) an area of the northeast of the Republic of Ireland that was a county (= an area with its own local government) until 1994: The Magdalene Sisters is set in Dublin county in 1964. She was brought up in County Dublin and educated at a convent school.
More examplesFewer examplesShe was found dead at her home in The Naul, County Dublin.Tom Dreaper's small yard in County Dublin contained several great horses.
